summary.span: 提供 和 对象的集合。

span.span: Provides a collection of and objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类为一组和实例提供基于集合的包装 。The class provides a collection-based wrapper over a set of and instances. 这些实例可通过按顺序在集合上按序号索引或键值来进行检索。These instances are retrieved by iterating sequentially over the collection, by ordinal index or by key value. 实例按路径和用户名的组合进行索引。Instances are indexed on a combination of path and user name. 这是必需的 ，因为表示共享数据的实例是根据对象进行索引的 ，而 实例是根据 对象和对象建立索引的 。This is necessary because instances representing shared data are indexed according to object, whereas instances are indexed according to both a object and a object. 信息对象在集合中的维护顺序与从提供程序接收信息对象的顺序相同。The information objects are maintained in the collection in the order in which they were received from the provider. 集合不会尝试更改实例的顺序，也不会在集合中维护特定的排序顺序。The collection does not attempt to change the order of the instances or maintain a specific sort order within the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
abstract member GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator override this.GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator

summary.span: 返回能遍历集合的标准枚举数。

span.span: Returns a standard enumerator capable of iterating over the collection.
This method cannot be inherited.

returns.span: 可用于循环访问集合的 。

span.span: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 方法还将枚举器恢复到此位置。The method also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置， 属性未定义。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，在读取的值之前，必须调用 方法，以将枚举器前进到集合的第一个元素 。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 有关枚举器的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information on enumerators, see . 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. C# 语言的 `foreach` 语句（在 Visual Basic 中为 `for each`）隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization.

value.span: 对于由 Web 部件控件集创建的 对象，该值总为 。

span.span: The value is always for objects created by the Web Parts control set.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 属性返回一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 的访问。The property returns an object, which can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性是集合的默认索引器。This property is the default indexer for the collection. 如果仅 `path` 提供，则属性返回一个 实例。If only `path` is provided, the property returns a instance. 如果同时 `path` `username` 提供了和，则属性将返回 和的组合的实例 `path` `username` 。If both `path` and `username` are provided, the property returns a instance for the combination of `path` and `username`. 如果 `path` 在 `username` 设置为) 的情况下 (`null` 不存在，或者如果不 `username` 存在， `path` `null` 则返回。If `path` (in the case that `username` is set to `null`) does not exist, or if `username` and `path` do not exist, `null` is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法 从集合中移除派生的实例。This method removes a -derived instance from the collection. 删除的实例之后的任何元素将上移以占据空白位置。Any elements after the removed instance are moved up to occupy the vacant position. 在内部，集合的计数减少1。Internally, the count of the collection is decremented by one. 对于集合，当前处于活动状态的任何枚举器均无效。Any enumerators currently active against the collection are invalidated. 如果仅 `path` 提供了，则将 删除该路径的实例。If only `path` is provided, then the instance for that path is removed. 如果同时 `path` `username` 提供了和，则将 删除和的组合的 `path` 实例 `username` 。If both `path` and `username` are provided, then the instance for the combination of `path` and `username` is removed. > [!NOTE] > 您可以尝试从集合中删除不存在的项;此操作不会引发异常。You can try to remove a non-existing item from the collection; this action will not raise an exception.

value.span: Web 部件控件集返回对当前集合对象的引用。

span.span: The Web Parts control set returns a reference to the current collection object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads. 派生类可以使用属性提供自己的集合的同步版本 。Derived classes can provide their own synchronized versions of the collection using the property. 同步代码必须对集合的执行操作 ，而不是直接在集合本身上执行。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the of the collection, not directly on the collection itself. 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体地说，这样可与可能同时对集合实例进行修改的其他线程保持正确的同步。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection instance.
